channel.title: This Developer's Life
channel.description: Stories About Developers and Their Lives
channel.itunes:author: Rob Conery and Scott Hanselman
channel.itunes:subtitle: Stories about developers and their lives
channel.itunes:summary: Bringing a human slant to the tech industry

item.title: 1.1.5 Revolt
item.dc:creator: Rob Conery and Scott Hanselman
item.description:
In this special episode we explore the Egyptian revolution. We talk to Remon Zakaria about his experience writing software for a day job and overthrowing the government at night. Big thanks to Ahmed Remy and Reem Ahmed for their help.

Download Here
item.itunes:subtitle: In this special episode we explore the Egyptian revolution. We talk to Remon Zakaria about his experience writing software for a day job and overthrowing the government at night. Big thanks to Ahmed Remy and Reem Ahmed for their help. Download Here
item.itunes:author: Rob Conery and Scott Hanselman
item.itunes:summary: In this special episode we explore the Egyptian revolution. We talk to Remon Zakaria about his experience writing software for a day job and overthrowing the government at night. Big thanks to Ahmed Remy and Reem Ahmed for their help. Download Here

item.title: 1.1.4 Obsession
item.dc:creator: Rob Conery and Scott Hanselman
item.description:
Rob Sullivan talks about his obsessiveness and how it helps him, and hinders him in his job. Rory Blythe and Scott then talk openly about Rory's compulsion to keep learning - which he has embraced completely.

Download Here
item.itunes:subtitle: Rob Sullivan talks about his obsessiveness and how it helps him, and hinders him in his job. Rory Blythe and Scott then talk openly about Rory's compulsion to keep learning - which he has embraced completely. Download Here

item.itunes:summary: Rob Sullivan talks about his obsessiveness and how it helps him, and hinders him in his job. Rory Blythe and Scott then talk openly about Rory's compulsion to keep learning - which he has embraced completely. Download Here

item.title: 1.1.3 Competition
item.dc:creator: Rob Conery and Scott Hanselman
item.description:
In this episode we talk to competitors who are also programmers. Or, programmers who also compete. Are coders pre-wired for this? Jon Skeet, David Fowler, Aaron Jensen and Danielle Banks share their stories.

Download Here
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode we talk to competitors who are also programmers. Or, programmers who also compete. Are coders pre-wired for this? Jon Skeet, David Fowler, Aaron Jensen and Danielle Banks share their stories. Download Here

item.title: 1.1.2 Drive
item.dc:creator: Rob Conery and Scott Hanselman
item.description:
In this episode Scott and Rob talk to 4 entrepreneurs about the risks they take, and what's happened as a result. Dave Nielsen, Tom Preston-Werner, and Nate and Niki Kohari.

Download Here
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode Scott and Rob talk to 4 entrepreneurs about the risks they take, and what's happened as a result. Dave Nielsen, Tom Preston-Werner, and Nate and Niki Kohari. Download Here

item.title: 1.1.1 Scars
item.dc:creator: Rob Conery and Scott Hanselman
item.description:
In this episode Scott and Rob talk to Chad Myers, Chad Fowler, and Doug Rohrer about the scars they've received from dead end projects they've been on. In addition - Sara Chipps contributes her first story for us - interviewing Scott Reynolds.

Download Here
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode Scott and Rob talk to Chad Myers, Chad Fowler, and Doug Rohrer about the scars they've received from dead end projects they've been on. In addition - Sara Chipps contributes her first story for us - interviewing Scott Reynolds. Download H

item.title: 1.1.0 Disconnecting
item.dc:creator: Rob Conery and Scott Hanselman
item.description:
This week it's just Scott and me - Scott gets to go off to Disneyland with his wife and 2 boys, and I get to hang out with my girls for a week as their mom goes on a retreat in California.

Download Here

item.title: 1.0.6 Abstraction
item.dc:creator: Rob Conery and Scott Hanselman
item.description:
In this episode Scott and I discuss "what you need to know as a software developer". How many layers of abstraction do you need to understand? How many geek trading cards should you have in your collection? To find out more, we talked to 3 prominent, living-history developers.

Download Here
